hero_title: I love learning and building Web Stuff!
hero_subtitle1: Software is for Humans and I believe in the power that the Web has to connect and educate us.
hero_subtitle2: I'm inspired by the history of the Women & Men: coders, engineers, entrepreneurs, and visionaries who helped create and shape the modern Web.
hero_subtitle3: The Web is for everyone and I wanted to contribute my part, so I got involved in the community and taught myself to code

hero_subtitle5: Heya world! I'm Mel Jones, an Australian-born & Berlin-based Front-end Developer.

faq.title: faqs
questions: I am Mel Jones and I was born in Melbourne, Australia. A love of travel lead her to backpack around Europe and settle in Berlin in 2013
What did you do before you learnt to code?

I have many years experience working in Customer Service, my first job was at McDonalds aged 15 :P! I spent many years climbing the fashion retail ladder, I loved working and managing teams, but fast fashion didn't make me happy. So I did some travelling and plenty of soul searching, and I have been working as noble bar lady.
How long have you been coding? and why did you start?

I started coding in high school, and continued for a year after graduation. But then I left to pursue fashion & customer Service. Late in 2018 I was having a conversation with a friend about the lack of diversity in Tech, and I thought hey I should try coding again. I did and immediately fell back in love. I've studying Frontend Development every since, close to 2 years now!
What kind of code do like to write?

I love everything frontend! User centered design. I'm a big fan of CSS, I recently got into utility first and Tailwind. I love playing around and building complex layouts with grid & flexbox. I love animations, I used to make flash animations back in the day and would love to spend some more time studying web animations and performance. And I love Vuejs and their community, I'm teaching myself Vue 3 right now
